item.title: 印度炼油商在特朗普威胁俄罗斯后抢购美国石油
item.description: 印度最大的炼油厂从美国和阿联酋抢购了数百万桶原油，而这个南亚国家正面临着美国和欧洲就其从俄罗斯购买原油而施加的越来越大的压力。【原文：India’s largest oil refiner has snapped up millions of barrels of crude from the US and UAE, with the South Asian nation facing mounting pressure from US and Europe over its purchases from Russia.】

item.title: 塞内加尔计划到 2028 年筹资 100 亿美元以摆脱债务危机
item.description: 塞内加尔将采取包括提高税收和重新谈判能源合同在内的措施，在三年内筹集近 100 亿美元，以帮助这个西非国家应对债务危机。【原文：Senegal will take steps including raising taxes and renegotiating energy contracts to raise almost $10 billion over three years to help the West African nation deal with a debt crisis.】

item.title: 美国 7 月杠杆贷款销售额飙升至新高，创历史新高
item.description: 7 月份，美国杠杆贷款发行量激增，原因是垃圾级借款人涌入市场，主要是为了重新定价债务，从而为公司节省数百万美元的利息支出。【原文：US leveraged-loan issuance skyrocketed in July as junk-rated borrowers flocked to the market largely to reprice debt, saving companies millions in interest expenses.】

item.title: 金巴利创十年来最佳业绩日，挤压短裤市场
item.description: 意大利蒸馏酒商 Davide-Campari Milano NV 正在给看跌的投机者一个下马威。【原文：Italian distiller Davide-Campari Milano NV is giving bearish speculators a run for their money.】

item.title: 特朗普 39% 的关税重磅炸弹引爆瑞士假日派对
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）令人震惊的惩罚性关税令瑞士的政界和商界精英们惶恐不安，而瑞士政府曾确信自己避免了这一行为。【原文：Switzerland’s political and business elite are reeling from Donald Trump’s shock punitive tariffs that the government was confident it had avoided.】

item.title: 智利经济活动因采矿业大跌而意外减少
item.description: 智利 6 月份的经济活动因采矿业骤降而连续第二个月意外下滑，而智利央行也发出了将在未来几个季度逐步降低利率的信号。【原文：Chile’s economic activity unexpectedly fell for the second straight month in June on a plunge in mining, as the central bank signals that it will gradually reduce its interest rate over coming quarters.】

item.title: 据说 General Atlantic 和 Oakley 接近以 10 亿欧元收购 Brevo
item.description: 据知情人士透露，由 General Atlantic 和 Oakley Capital 组成的财团即将达成收购 Brevo 的交易，对这家法国软件即服务企业的估值约为 10 亿欧元（11 亿美元）。【原文：A consortium consisting of General Atlantic and Oakley Capital is nearing a deal to buy Brevo in a deal that values the French software-as-a-service business at about €1 billion ($1.1 billion), people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 就业增长放缓推升美联储减息预期，国债跳涨
item.description: 在美国就业报告显示薪资增长逊于预期后，国债反弹，促使交易员加大了对美联储将降息的押注。【原文：Treasuries rallied after a report on US jobs showed weaker-than-expected payroll growth, prompting traders to boost bets that the Federal Reserve will lower interest rates.】

item.title: 美国在前几个月大幅下调就业岗位后新增 7.3 万个就业岗位
item.description: 在过去三个月中，美国的就业增长急剧降温，进一步证明了在经济不确定性普遍存在的情况下，劳动力市场正在转入低速增长。【原文：US job growth cooled sharply over the past three months, further evidence that the labor market is shifting into a lower gear amid widespread economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 埃克森美孚首席执行官伍兹表示正在寻找收购机会
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司首席执行官达伦-伍兹（Darren Woods）表示，在以 600 亿美元收购先锋自然资源公司（Pioneer Natural Resources Co.【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. is looking for opportunities to acquire smaller rivals, a year after buying Pioneer Natural Resources Co. for $60 billion, Chief Executive Officer Darren Woods said.】

item.title: 美联储沃勒尔和鲍曼以劳动力市场担忧为由提出异议
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）和米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）表示担心，央行在降息问题上的犹豫不决可能会给劳动力市场带来不必要的风险。【原文：Federal Reserve Governors Christopher Waller and Michelle Bowman expressed concerns that the central bank’s hesitance to lower interest rates could risk unnecessary damage to the labor market.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司 1.9 亿英镑债务交易，救援谈判遥遥无期
item.description: 本周，泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water）的一大笔债务易手，因为有关拯救这家濒临破产的公用事业公司的谈判尚未取得突破性进展。【原文：A chunk of Thames Water’s debt changed hands this week as negotiations over a rescue plan for the ailing utility have yet to yield a breakthrough.】

item.title: 南非央行因 CPI 变动引发财政部不满的风险
item.description: 南非中央银行绕过财政部，单方面下调了通胀目标。【原文：South Africa’s central bank has unilaterally lowered its inflation target, bypassing the finance ministry, which insists it alone holds the authority to set policy.】

item.title: 美国 7 月份就业报告分析
item.description: 加利福尼亚州萨克拉门托的一家金属制造厂。摄影师：大卫-保罗-莫里斯/布鲁姆伯格【原文：A metal manufacturing plant in Sacramento, California. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg】

item.title: 比特币在破纪录的七月后回落至三周低点
item.description: 比特币连续第五个交易日下跌，因为交易商继续从 7 月份美国拥抱数字资产的兴奋期所创下的历史高点回撤。【原文：Bitcoin declined for a fifth straight session as traders continue to pull back from the record highs reached in July during the euphoria around the US embrace of digital assets.】

item.title: 欧佩克+"正走近石油市场的另一个十字路口
item.description:
如果以沙特为首的卡特尔在本周末批准增产，那么它就必须决定 是否将增产提升到一个新的水平。【原文：

If the Saudi-led cartel approves an output increase this weekend, it must then decide whether to take that to the next level.

】

item.title: 霸菱通过第二笔交易推动欧洲私人信贷 CLO 的发展
item.description: 在私人信贷公司面临全球融资放缓之际，霸菱注册了其第二家欧洲中型市场 CLO，而这距离该地区第一家 CLO 注册仅过去了几个月。【原文：Barings has registered its second European middle-market CLO, just months after launching the region’s first, stepping up efforts to tap new capital as private credit firms face a global fundraising slowdown.】

item.title: 日本人气作家千川理解我们的现代焦虑
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，Natsuko Katsuki 报道日本漫画人物千川受欢迎背后的辛酸。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Natsuko Katsuki reports on the poignancy beneath the popularity of Japanese manga character Chiikawa.】

item.title: 当人工智能与我们作对时会发生什么？
item.description:

item.title: 巴宝莉成为焦点，英国在欧洲并购目标调查中占主导地位
item.description: 包括巴宝莉集团（Burberry Group Plc）在内的英国公司在被视为潜在收购目标的欧洲上市企业中占据着主导地位，英国股票估值的折扣使它们对买家的吸引力与日俱增。【原文：British companies including Burberry Group Plc dominate the ranks of European listed firms tipped as potential takeover targets, with discounted UK equity valuations making them increasingly enticing to buyers.】

item.title: 风险投资家资助大学校园掀起新一轮加密货币狂潮
item.description: 随着加密货币的声誉在公众舆论场中得到谨慎的恢复，风险投资公司正在资助大学校园里新一轮的区块链活动。【原文：As crypto’s reputation undergoes a cautious rehabilitation in the court of public opinion, venture capital firms are funding a new wave of blockchain activity on college campuses.】

item.title: 花旗银行认为美国加征关税后非洲将与中国和欧盟开展更多贸易
item.description: 花旗集团地区办事处负责人表示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布一系列新关税措施后，非洲的贸易流可能会进一步远离美国。【原文：African trade flows may shift further away from the US after President Donald Trump announced a slew of new tariffs, the head of Citigroup Inc.’s regional office said.】

item.title: 特朗普征收 25% 关税后，印度有望与美国进一步谈判
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对南亚国家征收 25% 的关税后，新德里的一位官员表示，印度期待美国贸易谈判代表本月晚些时候访问该国，继续就双边协议进行谈判。【原文：India expects US trade negotiators to visit the country later this month to continue talks on a bilateral deal, an official in New Delhi said, after President Donald Trump hit the South Asian nation with a 25% tariff.】

item.title: 埃克森公司盈利超出预期，石油产量缓解油价跌势
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司公布的业绩好于预期，原因是二叠纪盆地和圭亚那的石油产量强劲，缓解了原油价格下跌的影响。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. posted better-than-expected results after robust oil production from the Permian Basin and Guyana cushioned the impact of lower crude prices.】

item.title: Rokos 加入对冲基金行列，返还现金以限制资产飙升
item.description: 宏观交易专家克里斯-罗科斯（Chris Rokos）正准备首次将其对冲基金的现金交还给客户，加入史蒂夫-科恩（Steve Cohen）和肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）等同行的行列，放弃资本以限制其资金池的规模。【原文：Macro trading specialist Chris Rokos is preparing to hand back cash from his hedge fund to clients for the first time, joining peers such as Steve Cohen and Ken Griffin in spurning capital to restrict the size of their money pools.】

item.title: 美联储缩减开支，债券交易员密切关注就业数据
item.description:
过去一年中，两年期收益率平均因就业报告而变动了10个基点。【原文：

Two-year yields have moved an average 10 basis points on employment report over past year.

】

item.title: 日本央行观察家在贸易协议达成后提前发出下一次加息呼吁
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布了包括与日本达成的一项协议在内的多项贸易协议，从而使贸易问题更加明朗，日本央行观察人士提前预测了下一次加息的时间。【原文：Bank of Japan watchers brought forward their forecast for when they expect the next interest rate hike, after clarity over trade increased with US President Donald Trump announcing deals including one with Japan.】

item.title: 燃料成本飙升后，巴基斯坦 7 月通胀加速
item.description: 在政府提高国内燃料价格后，巴基斯坦的通货膨胀加速，这证明了决策者两天前出人意料地维持政策利率不变的决定是正确的。【原文：Pakistan’s inflation accelerated after the government increased domestic fuel prices, vindicating a decision by policymakers two days ago to unexpectedly keep policy rate unchanged.】

item.title: 引发韩国股市暴跌的税收计划被迫重新审议
item.description: 韩国对公司和投资者增税的计划导致周五全球最热门市场之一的韩国股市突然暴跌，韩国正面临着越来越多的不满，这可能会给总统李在明的国内议程带来麻烦。【原文：South Korea’s plan to hike taxes on companies and investors, which caused a sudden slump in one of the world’s hottest markets on Friday, is facing mounting discontent that could spell trouble for President Lee Jae Myung’s domestic agenda.】
